result.execSummary:
The defendant Diego A Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 301 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid a condition of Extended Supervision.

No contact with Victim C.V. dob 11/09/1998.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without prior Agent approval.
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program.
Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment.
No possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material.
No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with Internet capabilities without prior permission from the Agent.
Agent to monitor the Internet usage.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Received April 25, 2016,   Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Sentencing Hearing April 4, 2016, filed by Erin Furgason Official Reporter, Branch III

Defendant Diego A Rodriguez in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Hartley makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed Sentence of:
10 Years Imprisonment (Credit -301 days)
5 Years of Initial Confinement
5 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Victim C.V. dob 11/9/1998. 
No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without prior agent approval
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program
Cooperate, attend, and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your agent, including Sex Offender Treatment
No possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material
No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with internet capabilites without prior permission from the agent
Agent to monitor the internet usage
Cost: $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
DNA surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
